title: Destructuring Assignment
description: Extract values from arrays or properties from objects into distinct variables.

title: Spread Operator
description: Expand arrays or objects into individual elements. Great for copying and merging.

title: Optional Chaining
description: Safely access nested object properties without checking each level for null/undefined.

title: Nullish Coalescing
description: Provide a default value only when the left side is null or undefined (not falsy).
code:
const value1 = null ?? 'default';    // 'default'
const value2 = undefined ?? 'default'; // 'default'
const value3 = 0 ?? 'default';       // 0
const value4 = '' ?? 'default';      // ''
const value5 = false ?? 'default';   // false

title: Array Methods: map, filter, reduce
description: Transform, filter, and aggregate arrays in a functional programming style.

title: Template Literals
description: Create strings with embedded expressions and multi-line support.

title: Arrow Functions
description: Concise function syntax with lexical 'this' binding.

title: Async/Await
description: Write asynchronous code that looks synchronous. Much cleaner than promise chains.
resultHtml: Async/await makes async code readable like sync code!

title: Promise.all & Promise.allSettled
description: Run multiple promises concurrently and wait for all to complete.

title: Object Shorthand Properties
description: Create objects more concisely when variable names match property names.

title: Array.find & Array.findIndex
description: Find the first element or its index that matches a condition.

title: Array.includes & String.includes
description: Check if an array contains a value or a string contains a substring.

title: Object.entries, Object.keys, Object.values
description: Convert objects to arrays for easy iteration.

title: Default Parameters
description: Set default values for function parameters.

title: Rest Parameters
description: Collect multiple arguments into an array.

title: Array.flat & Array.flatMap
description: Flatten nested arrays and combine map + flatten operations.

title: Set for Unique Values
description: Store unique values of any type. Perfect for removing duplicates.

title: Map for Key-Value Pairs
description: Store key-value pairs where keys can be any type (unlike objects).

title: Logical Assignment Operators
description: Combine logical operators with assignment for cleaner code.

title: String Methods: padStart, padEnd
description: Pad strings to a certain length with a specified character.

title: Array.at() for Negative Indexing
description: Access array elements with negative indices to count from the end.

title: Object.fromEntries
description: Convert an array of key-value pairs back into an object.
resultHtml:
fromEntries = { name: "John", age: 30 }
doubled = { apple: 2, banana: 4, orange: 6 }

title: Numeric Separators
description: Use underscores in numbers for better readability.

title: Private Class Fields
description: Create truly private properties in classes using # prefix.

title: Array.prototype.toSorted & toReversed
description: Create sorted/reversed copies without mutating the original array.

title: Ternary Operator
description: Shorthand for if-else statements, perfect for conditional assignments.

title: Short-Circuit Evaluation
description: Use && and || for concise conditional logic.

title: Console Methods Beyond log
description: Use specialized console methods for better debugging.
resultHtml:
â–¼ User Details
Name: John
Age: 30
loop: 2.5ms

title: JSON.stringify with Replacer & Space
description: Format and filter JSON output for better readability.

title: Debounce Function
description: Limit how often a function can fire. Great for search inputs and resize events.
resultHtml: Only fires after user stops typing for 300ms!
